meanings.definition: A sound, especially one that is loud, unpleasant, or disturbing.
meanings.sent1: The noise of the thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The noise of the traffic outside woke me up early.
meanings.sent3: The noise of the squeaky toy made the puppy jump with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The noise of the alarm clock shattered the peaceful morning.
meanings.sent5: The noise of the fireworks filled the night sky with color and sound.

meanings.definition: A disturbance or interference that interrupts a signal or communication.
meanings.sent1: The static noise on the radio made it hard to hear the music.
meanings.sent2: The noise on the phone call made it difficult to understand the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The noise on the baby monitor accidentally woke up the sleeping parents.
meanings.sent4: The noise on the TV screen distorted the image on the news report.
meanings.sent5: The noise on the walkie-talkie disrupted the important message from being received.

meanings.sent1: The noise in the background of the meeting made it hard to focus on the speaker.
meanings.sent2: The noise in the email thread was confusing and unnecessary.
meanings.sent3: The noise in the textbook made it challenging to find the key information.
meanings.sent4: The noise in the report distracted from the main points being discussed.
meanings.sent5: The noise in the conversation led to misunderstandings and confusion among the group.
